Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a non-negotiable human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' in the bill is subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
Governments cannot effectively police subjective perceptions of harm.
There is a trend of increasing restrictions on speech in Australia, and this bill represents an extreme version of that trend.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of any kind doesn’t guarantee that people will always make the right choices. But taking away that freedom guarantees that people and their choices are not important anymore.
The bill states that 'misinformation' includes that which leads to ‘harm’, including psychological harm. But this is very subjective.
